intro: Benthamidia florida, commonly known as the Florida benthamidia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along riverbanks and wetlands. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Benthamidia florida is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
